meanings.definition: To say or read aloud words to be transcribed
meanings.sent1: She was dictating a letter to her secretary.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was dictating the spelling words to the students.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started dictating a shopping list to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to be dictating the direction of the sailboat.
meanings.sent5: The conductor was dictating the tempo of the music with his baton.

meanings.sent1: The general was dictating the battle strategy to his troops.
meanings.sent2: The boss was dictating the new project deadlines to the team.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought he was dictating the rules to his parents.
meanings.sent4: The storm was dictating the evacuation of the coastal town.
meanings.sent5: The captain was dictating the movements of the players on the field.

meanings.sent1: The scientist was dictating the parameters of the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The CEO was dictating the company's future direction.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to be dictating the movements of the cards.
meanings.sent4: The artist was dictating the colors and shapes of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The coach was dictating the team's defensive strategy on the court.
